subject: Programming
title: Breadth-First Search
description: A quick win: understand Breadth-First Search.

hook.text: Imagine finding the nearest coffee shop by checking every place one block away, then two, then three.

buildup.text: Breadth-first search explores all neighbors first before moving deeper into the graph.

discovery.text: It guarantees the shortest path in unweighted graphs. The first time it reaches a node is the best.

twist.text: BFS uses a queue and can consume lots of memory on wide graphs with millions of nodes.

climax.text: Social network features like 'people you may know' run on variations of breadth-first search.

punchline.text: Go wide before you go deep.

quiz.question: What does breadth-first search guarantee on unweighted graphs?
